metadata.dc:title: Between masochism and self destruction. Psychoanalytic reflections from The pianist by Elfride Jelinek
metadata.dc:description: Through the psychoanalytic Reading of the novel The Pianist (by E. Jelinek) the author intends to think about masochism, psychosis, incest and destructivity in a mother-daughter relationship stigmatized by the absence of individuation. Masochism is used by the protagonist to deny separation from the primary incestuous object as well as to try to establish limits in several trial of individuation which always fail. In this novel as well as in the protagonist, masochism leaves its function of live preserver and transforms progressively in unlinked energy which pushes the protagonist to self destruction (AU)
metadata.dc:creator: Burdet, Martina
metadata.dc:title: Entre masoquismo y autodestrucción: reflexiones psicoanalíticas sobre 'La pianista' de Elfriede Jelinek
